content:
• Tuesday, August 23, 2011
  • AIXXF

    German chip equipment maker Aixtron (AIXG) rose 10% today on analyst speculation the company...

    German chip equipment maker Aixtron (AIXG) rose 10% today on analyst speculation the company could be a buyout target due to the recent decline in its shares. One analyst suggests Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) is a potential buyer, while another thinks the Chinese government could make a bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • IPHI

    Semiconductor firm Inphi (NYSE:IPHI) plummets in after hours trading after cutting its Q3...

    Semiconductor firm Inphi (NYSE:IPHI) plummets in after hours trading after cutting its Q3 guidance due to a slowdown in orders and delays in shipping its next generation iMB and RDIMM products. The company now expects Q3 revenue in the range of $16M to $18M, below consensus estimates of $23M. Shares -27% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVGO

    Analog chipmaker Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO) is up 8.1% AH after posting FQ3 results that...

    Analog chipmaker Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO) is up 8.1% AH after posting FQ3 results that beat Street forecasts. The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue growth of 2%-5%; the midpoint of that range is above consensus. Avago's results are going over well with a market put on edge by soft results from both analog vendors and their customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • VG

    Vonage (VG +17.9%) ramps higher today on reports that Apple's (AAPL +4.8%) new iPhone 5 will be...

    Vonage (VG +17.9%) ramps higher today on reports that Apple's (AAPL +4.8%) new iPhone 5 will be CDMA and GSM compatible, giving it the potential for European coverage using Vonage's VoIP iPhone app.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • DY

    Dycom (NYSE:DY): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $303M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares...

    Dycom (NYSE:DY): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $303M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • HEI

    Defense and aerospace manufacturer HEICO (HEI +12.3%) closes higher after Wedbush upgraded the...

    Defense and aerospace manufacturer HEICO (HEI +12.3%) closes higher after Wedbush upgraded the shares to outperform earlier today, citing the company's strong fundamentals and free cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • EWBC

    East West Bancorp (EWBC +7.4%) posts a tidy gain, shrugging off Cantor Fitzgerald's decision to...

    East West Bancorp (EWBC +7.4%) posts a tidy gain, shrugging off Cantor Fitzgerald's decision to reduce its price target on share to $26 from $20. The firm keeps its FY12 EPS estimate of $1.80 in place for the bank holding company.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (FOSL +16%) gains today, largely due to a technical rebound off extreme oversold...

    Fossil (FOSL +16%) gains today, largely due to a technical rebound off extreme oversold conditions - the stock has lost nearly 35% of its value over the past 30 days - but also boosted by reports yesterday of the CFO purchasing shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • AVGO

    Avago Technologies Ltd(NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $603M (+10%...

    Avago Technologies Ltd(NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $603M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • NBL

    Noble Energy (NBL +4.6%) holds on to gains late in the day after Howard Weil upgrades the shares...

    Noble Energy (NBL +4.6%) holds on to gains late in the day after Howard Weil upgrades the shares to market outperform, citing the benefits of the company's recent $3.4B joint venture with Consol Energy (CNX +3.4%) in the Marcellus shale.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +10.8%) shoots higher on a WSJ report the carrier will be selling Apple's...

    Sprint (S +10.8%) shoots higher on a WSJ report the carrier will be selling Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone 5. Rumors of Sprint offering the next iPhone have existed for months.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Stocks shrug off the earthquake and weak economic news to rocket higher into the last 40 minutes...

    Stocks shrug off the earthquake and weak economic news to rocket higher into the last 40 minutes of trading. DJIA +2.7%, S&P 500 +3%, Nasdaq +3.9%. Disturbingly, 2 important financials can't get out of their own way. BAC -3%, GS -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 5 Comments
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU +3.5%) announces a partnership with TAM (TAM +8.7%) to connect flyers through...

    JetBlue (JBLU +3.5%) announces a partnership with TAM (TAM +8.7%) to connect flyers through Brazil, Orlando and New York's JFK airport. Customers will be able to use both carriers' flights on a single e-ticket itinerary.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN +17.1%), which runs several mining properties in Asia and Australia, is up...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN +17.1%), which runs several mining properties in Asia and Australia, is up 17.3% as TD Newcrest upgrades shares to Speculative Buy. TD is positive on the prospects of Ivanhoe's Oyu Tolgoi project in Mongolia, believing commercial production will start in 1H 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • D

    Dominion Resources (NYSE:D) loses all offsite power at its North Anna nuclear plant in Virginia,...

    Dominion Resources (NYSE:D) loses all offsite power at its North Anna nuclear plant in Virginia, and is using backup generators to keep spent fuel cool. D's shares fell more than 2% immediately following the quake before rebounding a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLD

    Gold is experiencing a rare sharp sell-off, now at $1,848/oz. after hitting $1,915 overnight....

    Gold is experiencing a rare sharp sell-off, now at $1,848/oz. after hitting $1,915 overnight. Despite the near $70 plunge, gold remains at a level it had never seen as recently as last Friday. GLD -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 8 Comments
  • BID

    Auction dealer Christie's is fuming rival Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) scored the rights to sell 4 works...

    Auction dealer Christie's is fuming rival Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) scored the rights to sell 4 works by the painter Clifford Still to benefit a Denver museum, calling the awarding of the contract "arbitrary and capricious" in a press release. Whether investors care about the arthouse squabble or not, shares of BID are now up 14.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning (TUES +10.9%) adds to last night's after-hours gain on an in-line FQ4 earnings...

    Tuesday Morning (TUES +10.9%) adds to last night's after-hours gain on an in-line FQ4 earnings report plus the announcement of a $5M stock buyback. Avondale Partners notes the buyback gives a "positive psychological boost to shares and affirms the company's expected ability to generate future cash flow."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • KHC

    H.J. Heinz (HNZ -2.8%) is trading down today as Q2 estimates beat, but earnings fell 6% Y/Y on...

    H.J. Heinz (HNZ -2.8%) is trading down today as Q2 estimates beat, but earnings fell 6% Y/Y on restructuring charges, higher commodity prices and lower sales volume. The company says consumers are "buffeted by economic uncertainty," and it plans to add more products at reduced prices to try to draw in lower-income shoppers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • GLCH

    Boutique investment bank Gleacher & Co. (GLCH +12.1%) trades higher after announcing late...

    Boutique investment bank Gleacher & Co. (GLCH +12.1%) trades higher after announcing late yesterday that it was shutting down its struggling equities unit, cutting 62 jobs, and realigning its investment banking operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • DAKT

    Daktronics (DAKT +3.1%) is trading higher today, despite missing FQ1 estimates. Investors are...

    Daktronics (DAKT +3.1%) is trading higher today, despite missing FQ1 estimates. Investors are focused the company's better margin growth, as net income rose 38% on a jump in new orders from the company's commercial business.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -3.3%) fires back with both barrels at Henry Blodget's belief that it could...

    Bank of America (BAC -3.3%) fires back with both barrels at Henry Blodget's belief that it could need to fill in a capital hole as big as $200B: "Blodget is making 'exaggerated and unwarranted claims,' which is what the SEC stated publicly when he was permanently banned from the securities industry in 2003... sovereign exposure is off by a factor of 10."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) is up 5.3% as Credit Suisse's Stephen Ju initiates coverage with an Outperform...

    Priceline (PCLN) is up 5.3% as Credit Suisse's Stephen Ju initiates coverage with an Outperform and $720 PT. Though considering the U.S. online travel market saturated, Ju thinks growing international penetration can drive 20%+ growth over the next 5 years. Ju is less positive on Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE), believing it's less likely to gain market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • TPR

    Coach (COH +6.8%) pops after Jefferies ups the shares to buy on valuation, citing the luxury...

    Coach (COH +6.8%) pops after Jefferies ups the shares to buy on valuation, citing the luxury handbag maker's "powerful brand" and sales momentum. Jefferies also notes the company has recently accelerated its distribution in Asia, and sees opportunities in China materializing faster than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • SFD

    Shares of Smithfield Foods (SFD +5.4%) bounce after Barclays initiates coverage with an Equal...

    Shares of Smithfield Foods (SFD +5.4%) bounce after Barclays initiates coverage with an Equal Weight rating and a $23 PT - marking a 15% upside potential for shares. The company's image will get a boost with the announcement it was the only food and beverage firm rated A+ for sustainability reporting.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • PHM

    PulteGroup (PHM -5.9%) is one of the biggest losers in the S&P 500 today, getting hit hard...

    PulteGroup (PHM -5.9%) is one of the biggest losers in the S&P 500 today, getting hit hard over a weak report on July new home sales, as well as a credit downgrade earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK -6.1%) is selling off for the second straight day after surging last week on...

    Eastman Kodak (EK -6.1%) is selling off for the second straight day after surging last week on the company's plans to sell off its valuable patent portfolio. Investors could be nervous about an Aug. 30 legal ruling regarding Kodak's lawsuits against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Research In Motion (RIMM).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTSP

    NetSpend (NTSP +6.9%) shares burst higher with M&A speculation making the rounds, as a...

    NetSpend (NTSP +6.9%) shares burst higher with M&A speculation making the rounds, as a Reuters story describes its depressed stock price and cutthroat competition in the prepaid debit card market making it a potential takeover target. Green Dot (GDOT +1.6%) is seen as the likeliest buyer, with potential interest also coming from Capital One (COF +2.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • AMZN

    The risk trade is on today (equities are surging, gold is down, and long-term Treasurys are...

    The risk trade is on today (equities are surging, gold is down, and long-term Treasurys are slightly lower). And that means high-growth, high-beta Internet and cloud computing stocks are among the day's big winners. AMZN +6.2%. RAX +6%. EQIX +6.6%. BIDU +5.9%. CRM +5.1%. APKT +6.3%. SFLY +8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI +10.1%) shares soar following positive notes today from analysts at Needham and...

    OmniVision (OVTI +10.1%) shares soar following positive notes today from analysts at Needham and Lazard, based on its relationship with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), which uses Omni’s parts in the iPhone. Needham says shares have priced in a 50% loss of business at Apple to competing sensor maker Sony (NYSE:SNE), a worst-case scenario that is not likely to play out.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • BAC

    JPMorgan comes out to defend Bank of America (NYSE:BAC), and rumors begin to fly about Chase...

    JPMorgan comes out to defend Bank of America (NYSE:BAC), and rumors begin to fly about Chase taking over BofA. Highly unlikely, given the combined entity would have a far higher than allowable percentage of U.S. bank assets, and the backstop required by JPM would likely cause Cairo-like protests in the streets of D.C.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • UAA

    Sports apparel retailer Under Armour (UA +6%) continues to gain on the back of yesterday's...

    Sports apparel retailer Under Armour (UA +6%) continues to gain on the back of yesterday's upgrade, as do related issues: Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +2.6%), Foot Locker (FL +3.6%), Nike (NKE +3.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment

  • Heartened by the risk rally, WTI crude jumps 2% in minutes, now at $86.22/barrel. Helped along...

    Heartened by the risk rally, WTI crude jumps 2% in minutes, now at $86.22/barrel. Helped along by the rebel success in Libya, WTI continues to narrow the spread with Brent crude. WTI ETF: USO +1.9%, Brent ETF: BNO +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • TSL

    After dipping over 6% at the open on a weak Q2 earnings report, Trina Solar (NYSE:TSL) has made...

    After dipping over 6% at the open on a weak Q2 earnings report, Trina Solar (NYSE:TSL) has made a stunning reversal and is now trading +13.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +3.3%) announces a deal allowing subscribers in Latin American countries to stream...

    Netflix (NFLX +3.3%) announces a deal allowing subscribers in Latin American countries to stream up to 1,200 hours of Telemundo's Spanish-language programming. The move follows up on NFLX's goal to start offering video services in 41 new countries this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • USAK

    USA Truck (USAK -25.6%) gets hammered this morning after it guides lower for the current...

    USA Truck (USAK -25.6%) gets hammered this morning after it guides lower for the current quarter, now expecting a loss in Q3. The Arkansas-based trucker cites "unanticipated difficulties" in transitioning over to a new operating system, as well as a "deterioration in general truckload market conditions" for the loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT +2%) shares are on the move after announcing it will develop and market cloud...

    Microsoft (MSFT +2%) shares are on the move after announcing it will develop and market cloud computing products in China with China Standard Software. The agreement could serve as a model for the firm to introduce similar cloud projects in other emerging markets, Microsoft's Sandy Gupta says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • VTR

    Senior care property REIT Ventas (VTR +1.3%) is higher this morning after the U.S. District...

    Senior care property REIT Ventas (VTR +1.3%) is higher this morning after the U.S. District Court cleared the way yesterday for it to collect on a $102M penalty owed by its rival HCP (HCP +0.7%). The payment stems from a 2009 judgment in connection with Ventas's acquisition of Sunrise Senior Living REIT from HCP in 2007.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) is now up 19.6% on news of its OLED partnership with Samsung...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) is now up 19.6% on news of its OLED partnership with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF). Brigantine is upgrading shares to Buy, believing the company will profit as AUO, LPL, SNE, and others ramp OLED production. While the Samsung deal only involves license fees, PANL could try to collect royalties from other manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • BMO

    Bank of Montreal (BMO +3.1%) trades higher this morning after its FQ3 easily beat estimates....

    Bank of Montreal (BMO +3.1%) trades higher this morning after its FQ3 easily beat estimates. Profits rose over 18% Y/Y on a jump in net interest income and lower credit loss provisions, plus revenue and market-share gains in its domestic retail bank and capital-markets units.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • PWRD

    Chinese online-game developer Perfect World (PWRD +14.2%) jumps after reporting a solid Q2....

    Chinese online-game developer Perfect World (PWRD +14.2%) jumps after reporting a solid Q2. Profit rose 61% on strong online revenue growth and improved cost controls, as efforts put in place last quarter to retool its strategy begin to bear fruit. Separately, ThinkEquity and CLSA both upgrade the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • PWRD

    Chinese online games developer Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD) pops 14% after reporting Q2 revenue...

    Chinese online games developer Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD) pops 14% after reporting Q2 revenue of $120.6M (+32% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.01, beating consensus by $12.8M and $0.44. Overseas licensing declined to 8.6% of revenue. The company expects 15-22% revenue growth in Q3, above a 14.5% consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • LDK

    Always-fickle solar stocks (TAN +6%) come out of the gate blazing, led by LDK Solar (LDK +8.5%)...

    Always-fickle solar stocks (TAN +6%) come out of the gate blazing, led by LDK Solar (LDK +8.5%) and JA Solar (JASO +8.8%). Not quite playing along are shares of Suntech Power (NYSE:STP), down 4.4%, mired in a two-day slump after reporting underwhelming Q2 results and getting hit with a downgrade to Underperform from Macquarie.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +8.4%) is shooting higher as Wells Fargo's David Wong upgrades shares to...

    Nvidia (NVDA +8.4%) is shooting higher as Wells Fargo's David Wong upgrades shares to Outperform. Wong thinks the company will get a boost from seasonal demand, and subsequently from a recovery in consumer PC sales. He also thinks the struggles of Nvidia's Tegra platform for smartphones/tablets are baked into its stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • TIN

    Temple-Inland (NYSE:TIN) falls 9.3% after a SEC filing discloses the company was named as a...

    Temple-Inland (NYSE:TIN) falls 9.3% after a SEC filing discloses the company was named as a defendent in a lawsuit alleging the firm caused the failure of Guaranty Financial Group.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • LNN

    Shares of Lindsay (LNN +6.2%) pop after Janney Capital upgrades the firm to a Buy rating from...

    Shares of Lindsay (LNN +6.2%) pop after Janney Capital upgrades the firm to a Buy rating from Neutral. The farming concern has booked 9 consecutive years of increasing its dividend payout.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • ARMH

    ARM Holdings (ARMH +3.7%) jumps on renewed takeover speculation after the Daily Mail writes that...

    ARM Holdings (ARMH +3.7%) jumps on renewed takeover speculation after the Daily Mail writes that Apple (AAPL +1.4%) could be looking to spend £10.1B to buy ARM. Shares remain higher even after CEO Warren East says the company wants to remain independent, and that few suitors would have anything to gain by owning it.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY) shares gained 9.3% on the Tokyo exchange on expectations the company is...

    Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY) shares gained 9.3% on the Tokyo exchange on expectations the company is taking steps to boost sales of its 3DS handheld console, which was launched earlier this year. Nintendo slashed 3DS prices in July, as the company struggles to deal with the growing popularity of smartphone gaming.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • BAC

    Peter Tchir is baffled that stocks are trying to push higher even as credit gets worse: "It is...

    Peter Tchir is baffled that stocks are trying to push higher even as credit gets worse: "It is interesting how many investors talk about credit leading the markets, but choose to ignore it when they see it." But Bank of America (BAC -6.2%) stock investors are getting the message, as five-year CDS spreads hit levels higher than during the peak of the financial crisis.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -5.9%) opens ugly, now threatening a $5 handle at $6.04.

    Bank of America (BAC -5.9%) opens ugly, now threatening a $5 handle at $6.04.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF) gains 3.1% premarket, moving higher with other financial stocks. Stifel...

    Capital One (NYSE:COF) gains 3.1% premarket, moving higher with other financial stocks. Stifel warms up to the outlook for credit card lenders, adding the firm to its Select List of favored stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • AAL

    BofA moves bullish on select airliners citing solid airline bookings and falling fuel prices...

    BofA moves bullish on select airliners citing solid airline bookings and falling fuel prices working in their favor. Merrill raised its rating on U.S. Airways (LCC) and Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) to Buy, and bumped up AMR (NASDAQ:AMR) to Neutral from Underperform. Premarket: LCC +3.1%, HA +11.3%, AMR +2%, DAL +1.9%, JBLU +1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • PMC

    Premarket gainers: PMC +38%. PANL +28%. MPEL +10%. OCR +9%. LLYG +7%. ERIC +4%. ARMH +4%. UBS...

    Premarket gainers: PMC +38%. PANL +28%. MPEL +10%. OCR +9%. LLYG +7%. ERIC +4%. ARMH +4%. UBS +3%. SNY +3%. GSK +3%. SODA +3%. SINA +3%. ALU +3%. AMR +3%. NVS +3%.
    Losers: TSL -7%. GSS -5%. GFI -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • BAC

    Recently looking like they would bounce a couple of percent at the open, Bank of America (BAC...

    Recently looking like they would bounce a couple of percent at the open, Bank of America (BAC -2%) shares have now turned lower premarket. Should the $6.29 indication hold, it would be a new low for the current move.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • UBS

    Shares of UBS are up 3.4% premarket after an earlier announcement on job cuts and an ambitious...

    Shares of UBS are up 3.4% premarket after an earlier announcement on job cuts and an ambitious $2.5B cost reduction plan. The firm's investment bankers look set to take the biggest hit after the company says it will slash costs 55% in the division.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCR

    Omnicare (NYSE:OCR) offers to purchase all outstanding shares of smaller rival PharMerica...

    Omnicare (NYSE:OCR) offers to purchase all outstanding shares of smaller rival PharMerica (NYSE:PMC) for $441M, or $15.00/share, representing a 37.2% premium from Monday's close. In a letter to PMC's board, Omnicare CEO John Figueroa says he prefers to reach a negotiated deal but will take the offer directly to shareholders if needed. PMC +37.1%, OCR +8.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • GS

    Shares of Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) bounce back a bit as follow-up reports indicate that...

    Shares of Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) bounce back a bit as follow-up reports indicate that CEO Lloyd Blankfein has not been subpoenaed and that no Goldman executive has received an individual subpoena. The company reportedly says Blankfein's hire of criminal defense attorney Reid Weingarten was routine. GS +0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM | 5 Comments
  • MLCO

    More on Melco Crown's (MPEL) Q2 report: Booked 253% increase in net revenue at its Macau City of...

    More on Melco Crown's (MPEL) Q2 report: Booked 253% increase in net revenue at its Macau City of Dreams property, boosted by improved rolling chip volumes and win rates. Non-gaming amenities also kicked-in to improved top-line result. Shares +9.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • GSK

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) are up 2.6% premarket after Brean Murray initiates its...

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) are up 2.6% premarket after Brean Murray initiates its rating on the firm with a Buy and a $22 PT. The stock closed yesterday just a hair above its 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • MLCO

    Melco Crown Entertainment (MPEL): Q2 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $960M (+67.4% Y/Y)...

    Melco Crown Entertainment (MPEL): Q2 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $960M (+67.4% Y/Y) beats by $35M. Shares +7.45% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) announces a 6-year OLED patent licensing and material supply...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) announces a 6-year OLED patent licensing and material supply agreement with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), the world's largest OLED display manufacturer. Judging by the 24.5% gain in Universal Display's shares yesterday, it looks like some knew about this deal in advance. PANL +12.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM

  • European shares open higher following gains in Asia as China's manufacturing activity eases...

    European shares open higher following gains in Asia as China's manufacturing activity eases fears of a downturn. However, flash PMI and other economic data due out today in Europe could limit any rises if bearish. EURO STOXX 50 +1.9%, London +1.3%, Paris +1.1%, Frankfurt +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 AM
